item.title: Logging with a key saved on a text file
item.dc:creator: Weebzo
item.description:
After the user logs in, you can take the string that contains the key and write it to a file using the File class of System.IO, File.WriteAllText(keystring, "key.txt");, and at the app startup you can do string savedKey = File.ReadAllText("key.txt"); to retrieve the file content and login with it. For example KeyAuthApp.license(savedkey);

Complete Code:

//After Login Code
if(!File.Exists("key.txt"))
{
   File.WriteAllText(keyString, "key.txt");
}
// App startup code
if(File.Exists("key.txt") && !String.IsNullOrEmpty(File.ReadAllText("key.txt")))
{
   string key = File.ReadAllText("key.txt");
   KeyAuthApp.license(key);
}

Read full topic
item.source: Logging with a key saved on a text file

item.title: Logging with a key saved on a text file
item.dc:creator: VVS
item.description:
I’ve made something like this but i am a very big retard ( dont know how to make logging in with only key ) it just doesnt work.

namespace KeyAuth
{
class Program
{

    public static api KeyAuthApp = new api(
        name: ".",
        ownerid: ".",
        secret: ".",
        version: "."
    );
    static void Main(string[] args)
    {
        string textFile = @"C:/ty.txt";

        string key = File.ReadAllText(textFile);
        Console.WriteLine(key);

        Thread.Sleep(5000);
        KeyAuthApp.license(key);
        Thread.Sleep(5000);

        if (!KeyAuthApp.response.success)
        {
            static void Something()
            {
                something is here
            }
            Something();
        }
    }
}

}
